alert.note: Alert for Essex; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 03 at 5:26PM EDT until August 03 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Franklin County in northern New York... Northwestern Essex County in northern New York... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 525 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ray Brook, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Keene, Keene Valley, Mount Marcy, North Elba, Upper Jay, Mount Van Hoevenberg, Ray Brook, Lake Colby, Mount Van Hoevenburg Recreation Area, and Bloomingdale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
